intro: Apotaenium capnoides, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its adaptations to harsh environments include a compact growth form and succulent leaves that store water.
